Let f \colon X \to S be a polarised abelian scheme of dimension g over a smooth connected base S. For s \in S, the fundamental group \pi _1(S,s) acts on the fibre \operatorname {H} ^1(X_s, \mathbb {Z} ) of \mathrm {R} _1f_* \mathbb {Z} over s. The polarisation of X defines an alternating form on \operatorname {H} ^1(X_s, \mathbb {Z} ), with values in \mathbb {Z} (-1), that is non-degenerate over \mathbb {Q}, and the action of \pi _1(S,s) respects this form.
